item.title: Interactive Mapping using Shapefiles and Plotly
item.description: There are many packages and options to display data on maps, but until recently I’d never worked with shapefiles as a way to receive and work with spatial objects. A friend asked me to create an interactive map of state congressional districts using some political data, and it gave me an opportunity to learn a lot about plotting with shapefiles. The Shapefiles I worked with shapefiles from Daily Kos Elections.

item.title: Setting Up This Site
item.description: To kick things off, I want to share some details about how I created this site in case they’re helpful for anyone else in the future. I landed on the GitHub/Hugo/blogdown workflow after some Google searching and went with it for a few reasons: I already had a GitHub account and wanted to get more practice using git, and take advantage of the free hosting options there. Amber Thomas provides a walkthrough of setting up a Hugo site using blogdown, and she made it look pretty simple.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
